info.title: crates.io
info.description:
__Experimental API documentation for the [crates.io](https://crates.io/)
package registry.__

This document describes the API used by the crates.io website, cargo
client, and other third-party tools to interact with the crates.io
registry.

Before using this API, please read the
[crates.io data access policy](https://crates.io/data-access) and ensure
that your use of the API complies with the policy.

__The API is under active development and may change at any time__,
though we will try to avoid breaking changes where possible.

Some parts of the API follow the "Registry Web API" spec documented
at <https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/registry-web-api.html>
and can be considered stable.

Most parts of the API do not require authentication. The endpoints
that do require authentication are marked as such in the documentation,
with some requiring cookie authentication (usable only by the web UI)
and others requiring API token authentication (usable by cargo and
other clients).

get.summary: List all crate owner invitations for a crate or user.

parameters.name: crate_name
parameters.description:
Filter crate owner invitations by crate name.

Only crate owners can query pending invitations for their crate.

parameters.name: invitee_id
parameters.description:
The ID of the user who was invited to be a crate owner.

This parameter needs to match the authenticated user's ID.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
The page number to request.

This parameter is mutually exclusive with `seek` and not supported for
all requests.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of items to request per page.

parameters.name: seek
parameters.description:
The seek key to request.

This parameter is mutually exclusive with `page` and not supported for
all requests.

The seek key can usually be found in the `meta.next_page` field of
paginated responses.

invitations.description: The list of crate owner invitations.

next_page.description: Query parameter string to fetch the next page of results.

users.description: The list of users referenced in the crate owner invitations.

get.description:
This route is called from the GitHub API OAuth flow after the user accepted or rejected
the data access permissions. It will check the `state` parameter and then call the GitHub API
to exchange the temporary `code` for an API token. The API token is returned together with
the corresponding user information.

see <https://developer.github.com/v3/oauth/#github-redirects-back-to-your-site>

## Query Parameters

- `code` – temporary code received from the GitHub API  **(Required)**
- `state` – state parameter received from the GitHub API  **(Required)**

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Temporary code received from the GitHub API.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: State parameter received from the GitHub API.

id.description: The opaque identifier of the crate.

owned_crates.description: The crates that the authenticated user owns.

get.description:
This route will return an authorization URL for the GitHub OAuth flow including the crates.io
`client_id` and a randomly generated `state` secret.

see <https://developer.github.com/v3/oauth/#redirect-users-to-request-github-access>

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The sort order of the categories.

Valid values: `alpha`, and `crates`.

Defaults to `alpha`.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
The page number to request.

This parameter is mutually exclusive with `seek` and not supported for
all requests.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of items to request per page.

parameters.name: seek
parameters.description:
The seek key to request.

This parameter is mutually exclusive with `page` and not supported for
all requests.

The seek key can usually be found in the `meta.next_page` field of
paginated responses.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Name of the category

put.summary: Marks the email belonging to the given token as verified.

parameters.name: email_token
parameters.description: Secret verification token sent to the user's email address

get.description:
Called in a variety of scenarios in the front end, including:
- Alphabetical listing of crates
- List of crates under a specific owner
- Listing a user's followed crates

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The sort order of the crates.

Valid values: `alphabetical`, `relevance`, `downloads`,
`recent-downloads`, `recent-updates`, `new`.

Defaults to `relevance` if `q` is set, otherwise `alphabetical`.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: A search query string.

schema.description: A string that does not contain null bytes (`\0`).

parameters.name: include_yanked
parameters.description: Set to `yes` to include yanked crates.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description:
If set, only return crates that belong to this category, or one
of its subcategories.

schema.description: A string that does not contain null bytes (`\0`).

parameters.name: all_keywords
parameters.description:
If set, only return crates matching all the given keywords.

This parameter expects a space-separated list of keywords.

schema.description: A string that does not contain null bytes (`\0`).

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description:
If set, only return crates matching the given keyword
(ignored if `all_keywords` is set).

schema.description: A string that does not contain null bytes (`\0`).

parameters.name: letter
parameters.description:
If set, only return crates with names that start with the given letter
(ignored if `all_keywords` or `keyword` are set).

schema.description: A string that does not contain null bytes (`\0`).

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description:
If set, only crates owned by the given crates.io user ID are returned
(ignored if `all_keywords`, `keyword`, or `letter` are set).

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description:
If set, only crates owned by the given crates.io team ID are returned
(ignored if `all_keywords`, `keyword`, `letter`, or `user_id` are set).

parameters.name: following
parameters.description:
If set, only crates owned by users the current user follows are returned
(ignored if `all_keywords`, `keyword`, `letter`, `user_id`,
or `team_id` are set).

The exact value of this parameter is ignored, but it must not be empty.

parameters.name: ids[]

items.description: A string that does not contain null bytes (`\0`).

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
The page number to request.

This parameter is mutually exclusive with `seek` and not supported for
all requests.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of items to request per page.

parameters.name: seek
parameters.description:
The seek key to request.

This parameter is mutually exclusive with `page` and not supported for
all requests.

The seek key can usually be found in the `meta.next_page` field of
paginated responses.

next_page.description: Query string to the next page of results, if any.

prev_page.description: Query string to the previous page of results, if any.

total.description: The total number of crates that match the query.

get.description:
This endpoint works around a small limitation in `axum` and is delegating
to the `GET /api/v1/crates/{name}` endpoint internally.

put.description:
Used by `cargo publish` to publish a new crate or to publish a new version of an
existing crate.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the crate

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
Additional data to include in the response.

Valid values: `versions`, `keywords`, `categories`, `badges`,
`downloads`, `default_version`, or `full`.

Defaults to `full` for backwards compatibility.

**Note**: `versions` and `default_version` share the same key `versions`, therefore `default_version` will be ignored if both are provided.

This parameter expects a comma-separated list of values.

delete.description:
The crate is immediately deleted from the database, and with a small delay
from the git and sparse index, and the crate file storage.

The crate can only be deleted by the owner of the crate, and only if the
crate has been published for less than 72 hours, or if the crate has a
single owner, has been downloaded less than 1000 times for each month it has
been published, and is not depended upon by any other crate on crates.io.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the crate

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the crate

trustpub_only.description: Whether this crate can only be published via Trusted Publishing.

get.summary: Get the download counts for a crate.
get.description:
This includes the per-day downloads for the last 90 days and for the
latest 5 versions plus the sum of the rest.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the crate

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
Additional data to include in the response.

Valid values: `versions`.

Defaults to no additional data.

This parameter expects a comma-separated list of values.

date.description: The date this download count is for.

downloads.description: The number of downloads on the given date.

version_downloads.description: The per-day download counts for the last 90 days.

versions.description:
The versions referenced in the download counts, if `?include=versions`
was requested.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the crate

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the crate

get.summary: Check if a crate is followed.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the crate

following.description: Whether the authenticated user is following the crate.

get.summary: List team owners of a crate.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the crate

get.summary: List user owners of a crate.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the crate

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the crate

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the crate

owners.description:
List of owner login names to add or remove.

For users, use just the username (e.g., `"octocat"`).
For GitHub teams, use the format `github:org:team` (e.g., `"github:rust-lang:owners"`).

msg.description: A message describing the result of the operation.
msg.example: user ghost has been invited to be an owner of crate serde

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the crate

owners.description:
List of owner login names to add or remove.

For users, use just the username (e.g., `"octocat"`).
For GitHub teams, use the format `github:org:team` (e.g., `"github:rust-lang:owners"`).

msg.description: A message describing the result of the operation.
msg.example: user ghost has been invited to be an owner of crate serde

get.summary: List reverse dependencies of a crate.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the crate

dependencies.description: The list of reverse dependencies of the crate.

versions.description: The versions referenced in the `dependencies` field.

get.summary: List all versions of a crate.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the crate

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
Additional data to include in the response.

Valid values: `release_tracks`.

Defaults to no additional data.

This parameter expects a comma-separated list of values.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The sort order of the versions.

Valid values: `date`, and `semver`.

Defaults to `semver`.

parameters.name: nums[]
parameters.description: If set, only versions with the specified semver strings are returned.

items.description: A string that does not contain null bytes (`\0`).

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
The page number to request.

This parameter is mutually exclusive with `seek` and not supported for
all requests.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of items to request per page.

parameters.name: seek
parameters.description:
The seek key to request.

This parameter is mutually exclusive with `page` and not supported for
all requests.

The seek key can usually be found in the `meta.next_page` field of
paginated responses.

next_page.description: Query string to the next page of results, if any.

release_tracks.description:
Additional data about the crate's release tracks,
if `?include=release_tracks` is used.

total.description: The total number of versions belonging to the crate.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the crate

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Version number

get.description:
This endpoint was deprecated by [RFC #3052](https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/3052)
and returns an empty list for backwards compatibility reasons.

get.description:
This information can also be obtained directly from the index.

In addition to returning cached data from the index, this returns
fields for `id`, `version_id`, and `downloads` (which appears to always
be 0)

parameters.name: name

delete.description:
This does not delete a crate version, it makes the crate
version accessible only to crates that already have a
`Cargo.lock` containing this version.

Notes:

Version deletion is not implemented to avoid breaking builds,
and the goal of yanking a crate is to prevent crates
beginning to depend on the yanked crate version.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the crate

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Version number

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The sort order of the keywords.

Valid values: `alpha`, and `crates`.

Defaults to `alpha`.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
The page number to request.

This parameter is mutually exclusive with `seek` and not supported for
all requests.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of items to request per page.

parameters.name: seek
parameters.description:
The seek key to request.

This parameter is mutually exclusive with `page` and not supported for
all requests.

The seek key can usually be found in the `meta.next_page` field of
paginated responses.

parameters.name: keyword

put.description:
This endpoint was implemented for an experimental feature that was never
fully implemented. It is now deprecated and will be removed in the future.

get.summary: List all API tokens of the authenticated user.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the API token

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the API token

get.summary: List versions of crates that the authenticated user follows.

more.description: Whether there are more versions to be loaded.

get.description:
Returns the current deployed commit SHA1 (or `unknown`), and whether the
system is in read-only mode.

banner_message.description: Optional banner message to display on all pages.

commit.description: The SHA1 of the currently deployed commit.

deployed_sha.description: The SHA1 of the currently deployed commit.

read_only.description: Whether the crates.io service is in read-only mode.

get.description:
This endpoint returns a summary of the most important data for the front
page of crates.io.

most_downloaded.description: The 10 crates with the highest total number of downloads.

most_recently_downloaded.description: The 10 crates with the highest number of downloads within the last 90 days.

num_crates.description: The total number of crates on crates.io.

num_downloads.description: The total number of downloads across all crates.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: Name of the team

delete.description:
This endpoint revokes the API token that is used to authenticate
the request.

get.summary: List Trusted Publishing configurations for GitHub Actions.

parameters.name: user_id

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
The page number to request.

This parameter is mutually exclusive with `seek` and not supported for
all requests.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of items to request per page.

parameters.name: seek
parameters.description:
The seek key to request.

This parameter is mutually exclusive with `page` and not supported for
all requests.

The seek key can usually be found in the `meta.next_page` field of
paginated responses.

next_page.description: Query string to the next page of results, if any.

total.description: The total number of GitHub configs belonging to the crate.

The access token is expected to be passed in the `Authorization` header
as a `Bearer` token, similar to how it is used in the publish endpoint.

parameters.name: id

get.description:
This currently only returns the total number of downloads for crates owned
by the user.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the user

total_downloads.description: The total number of downloads for crates owned by the user.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: Login name of the user

put.description:
This endpoint allows users to update their email address and publish notifications settings.

The `id` parameter needs to match the ID of the currently authenticated user.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: ID of the user

ApiToken.description: The model representing a row in the `api_tokens` database table.

crate_scopes.description: `None` or a list of crate scope patterns (see RFC #2947).

created_at.description: The date and time when the token was created.

endpoint_scopes.description: A list of endpoint scopes or `None` for the `legacy` endpoint scope (see RFC #2947).

expired_at.description: The date and time when the token will expire, or `null`.

id.description: An opaque unique identifier for the token.

last_used_at.description: The date and time when the token was last used.

avatar.description: The user's avatar URL, if set.

email.description: The user's email address, if set.

email_verification_sent.description: Whether the user's email address verification email has been sent.

email_verified.description: Whether the user's email address has been verified.

id.description: An opaque identifier for the user.

is_admin.description: Whether the user is a crates.io administrator.

name.description: The user's display name, if set.

publish_notifications.description: Whether the user has opted in to receive publish notifications via email.

crates_cnt.description: The total number of crates that have this category.

created_at.description: The date and time this category was created.

id.description: An opaque identifier for the category.

parent_categories.description:
The parent categories of this category.

This field is only present when the category details are queried,
but not when listing categories.

subcategories.description:
The subcategories of this category.

This field is only present when the category details are queried,
but not when listing categories.

categories.description: The list of categories belonging to this crate.

created_at.description: The date and time this crate was created.

default_version.description:
The "default" version of this crate.

This version will be displayed by default on the crate's page.

documentation.description: The URL to the crate's documentation, if set.

downloads.description: The total number of downloads for this crate.

exact_match.description: Whether the crate name was an exact match.

homepage.description: The URL to the crate's homepage, if set.

id.description: An opaque identifier for the crate.

keywords.description: The list of keywords belonging to this crate.

links.description: Links to other API endpoints related to this crate.

max_stable_version.description: The highest version number for this crate that is not a pre-release.

max_version.description: The highest version number for this crate.

newest_version.description: The most recently published version for this crate.

num_versions.description: The total number of versions for this crate.

recent_downloads.description: The total number of downloads for this crate in the last 90 days.

repository.description: The URL to the crate's repository, if set.

trustpub_only.description: Whether this crate can only be published via Trusted Publishing.

updated_at.description: The date and time this crate was last updated.

versions.description: The list of version IDs belonging to this crate.

yanked.description: Whether all versions of this crate have been yanked.

owner_team.description: The API path to this crate's team owners.

owner_user.description: The API path to this crate's user owners.

owners.description: The API path to this crate's owners.

reverse_dependencies.description: The API path to this crate's reverse dependencies.

version_downloads.description: The API path to this crate's download statistics.

versions.description: The API path to this crate's versions.

crate_id.description: The ID of the crate that the user was invited to be an owner of.

crate_name.description: The name of the crate that the user was invited to be an owner of.

created_at.description: The date and time this invitation was created.

expires_at.description: The date and time this invitation will expire.

invitee_id.description: The ID of the user who was invited to be a crate owner.

inviter_id.description: The ID of the user who sent the invitation.

token.description:
The plaintext API token.

Only available when the token is created.

crate_id.description: The name of the crate this dependency points to.

default_features.description: Whether default features are enabled for this dependency.

downloads.description: The total number of downloads for the crate this dependency points to.

features.description: The features explicitly enabled for this dependency.

id.description: An opaque identifier for the dependency.

kind.description: The type of dependency this is (normal, dev, or build).

req.description: The version requirement for this dependency.

target.description: The target platform for this dependency, if any.

version_id.description: The ID of the version this dependency belongs to.

crates_cnt.description: The total number of crates that have this keyword.

created_at.description: The date and time this keyword was created.

id.description: An opaque identifier for the keyword.

crate_id.description: The ID of the crate that the user was invited to be an owner of.

crate_name.description: The name of the crate that the user was invited to be an owner of.

created_at.description: The date and time this invitation was created.

expires_at.description: The date and time this invitation will expire.

invited_by_username.description: The username of the user who sent the invitation.

invitee_id.description: The ID of the user who was invited to be a crate owner.

inviter_id.description: The ID of the user who sent the invitation.

avatar.description: The avatar URL of the team or user.

id.description: The opaque identifier for the team or user, depending on the `kind` field.

kind.description: The kind of the owner (`user` or `team`).

login.description: The login name of the team or user.

name.description: The display name of the team or user.

url.description: The URL to the owner's profile.

id.description: An opaque identifier for the category.

avatar.description: The avatar URL of the team.

id.description: An opaque identifier for the team.

login.description: The login name of the team.

name.description: The display name of the team.

url.description: The GitHub profile URL of the team.

avatar.description: The user's avatar URL, if set.

id.description: An opaque identifier for the user.

name.description: The user's display name, if set.

time.description: The date and time the action was performed.

user.description: The user who performed the action.

audit_actions.description: A list of actions performed on this version.

bin_names.description: The names of the binaries provided by this version, if any.

checksum.description:
The SHA256 checksum of the compressed crate file encoded as a
hexadecimal string.

crate_size.description: The size of the compressed crate file in bytes.

created_at.description: The date and time this version was created.

description.description: The description of this version of the crate.

dl_path.description: The API path to download the crate.

documentation.description: The URL to the crate's documentation, if set.

downloads.description: The total number of downloads for this version.

edition.description: The Rust Edition used to compile this version, if set.

features.description: The features defined by this version.

has_lib.description: Whether this version can be used as a library.

homepage.description: The URL to the crate's homepage, if set.

id.description: An opaque identifier for the version.

lib_links.description: The name of the native library this version links with, if any.

license.description: The license of this version of the crate.

linecounts.description:
Line count statistics for this version.

Status: **Unstable**

This field may be `null` until the version has been analyzed, which
happens in an asynchronous background job.

links.description: Links to other API endpoints related to this version.

oneOf.description:
The user who published this version.

This field may be `null` if the version was published before crates.io
started recording this information.

readme_path.description: The API path to download the crate's README file as HTML code.

repository.description: The URL to the crate's repository, if set.

rust_version.description:
The minimum version of the Rust compiler required to compile
this version, if set.

trustpub_data.description:
Information about the trusted publisher that published this version, if any.

Status: **Unstable**

This field is filled if the version was published via trusted publishing
(e.g., GitHub Actions) rather than a regular API token.

The exact structure of this field depends on the `provider` field
inside it.

updated_at.description: The date and time this version was last updated (i.e. yanked or unyanked).

yank_message.description: The message given when this version was yanked, if any.

yanked.description: Whether this version has been yanked.

date.description: The date this download count is for.

downloads.description: The number of downloads for this version on the given date.

version.description: The ID of the version this download count is for.

authors.description: The API path to download this version's authors.

dependencies.description: The API path to download this version's dependencies.

version_downloads.description: The API path to download this version's download numbers.

api_token.name: authorization
api_token.description: The API token is used to authenticate requests from cargo and other clients.

cookie.name: cargo_session
cookie.description: The session cookie is used by the web UI to authenticate users.

trustpub_token.description: Temporary access tokens are used by the "Trusted Publishing" flow.
